org.fcrepo.kernel.api.models

Interface FedoraResource

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Container, FedoraBinary, NonRdfSourceDescription, Tombstone
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContainerImpl, FedoraBinaryImpl, FedoraResourceImpl, NonRdfSourceDescriptionImpl, TombstoneImpl

    public interface FedoraResource
    Since:
    Jan 10, 2014
    Author:
    ajs6f

      • hasType

        boolean hasType(String type)
        Check if this object uses a given RDF type

        Note: the type parameter should be in prefixed short form, so ldp:Container or ex:Image are both acceptable types. This method does not assume any jcr to fedora prefix mappings are managed by the implementation, so hasType("jcr:frozenNode") is a valid use of this method.

        Parameters:
        type - the given type
        Returns:
        whether the object has the given type

      • getTypes

        List<URI> getTypes()
        Get the RDF:type values for this resource
        Returns:
        a list of types for this resource

      • updateProperties

        void updateProperties(IdentifierConverter<org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Resource,FedoraResource> idTranslator,
                      String sparqlUpdateStatement,
                      RdfStream originalTriples)
               throws MalformedRdfException,
                      AccessDeniedException
        Update the provided properties with a SPARQL Update query. The updated properties may be serialized to the JCR store. After applying the statement, clients SHOULD check the result of #getDatasetProblems, which may include problems when attempting to serialize the data to JCR.
        Parameters:
        idTranslator - the property of idTranslator
        sparqlUpdateStatement - sparql update statement
        originalTriples - original triples
        Throws:
        MalformedRdfException - if malformed rdf exception occurred
        AccessDeniedException - if access denied in updating properties

      • getEtagValue

        String getEtagValue()
        Construct an ETag value from the last modified date and path. JCR has a mix:etag type, but it only takes into account binary properties. We actually want whole-object etag data. TODO : construct and store an ETag value on object modify
        Returns:
        constructed etag value

      • getVersionLabelOfFrozenResource

        String getVersionLabelOfFrozenResource()
        This method returns the version label of this frozen resource. If this resource is not frozen, null is returned.
        Returns:
        version label
